UPDATE: On the 27th June 2020 in the UK, ministers announced that Blanket restrictions on non-essential overseas travel will be relaxed in the UK from 6 July. description:
In England (UK), on 26th March, The Health Protection (Coronavirus, Restrictions) (England) Regulations 2020 came into effect. From this, all premises in which food or drink are sold for consumption on those premises are required to close and to cease selling food or drink for consumption on its premises. This excludes hotels and other accomodation. 
Businesses selling or hiring goods in a shop, or providing library services must cease to carry on that business or provide that service except by making deliveries or through a website/online communication, telephone, or post. This excludes any business which provides hot or cold food for consumption off the premises.
Businesses consisting of the provision of holiday accommodation must cease to carry on that business. However, such a business can provide accommodation to any person who: is unable to return to their main residence; uses that accommodation as their main residence; needs accommodation while moving house or to attend a funeral; otherwise homeless. Such a business can stay open to provide accommodation or support services for the homeless or to host blood donation sessions.
